resources.string:
μg/m³ - micrograms (one-millionth of a gram) per cubic meter air. 

Particles with a diameter of 10 microns or less (PM10) are inhalable into the lungs and can induce adverse health effects. 

Fine particulate matter is defined as particles that are 2.5 microns or less in diameter (PM2.5). 

Carbon monoxide (CO) is a colorless, odorless gas. 

Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) is a pungent gas that, along with fine airborne particulate matter, contributes to the reddish-brown haze characteristic of smoggy air. 

Sulfur dioxide (SO2) is comprised of one atom of sulfur and two atoms of oxygen, and is a gas at ambient temperatures. It has a pungent, irritating odor.
